subject: OT [Re: [junit] Will someone please respond?]
msgSnippet: Everyone: I recently started my own consulting company, left my relatively cushy full-time job, started teaching part-time and have much less time than I used
messageBody:
Everyone:

I recently started my own consulting company, left my relatively cushy
full-time job, started teaching part-time and have much less time than I
used to have at work to monitor this list and answer questions. I'm
doing XP in my new job. You know how they say that XP makes you anxious
to work in the morning , then tired and satisfied at night? It has done
that for me so far. When I get home, I'm tired -- I don't jump at the
computer like I used to. As a result, I don't have as much energy to
answer questions as I used to. When someone writes a message that I
interpret as "Where are you lazy bastards? Answer my question!" I get
angry most times. I get even more angry now. That is why I responded the
way I did.

Soon I expect I'll be back to normal and be able to think long and hard
about each of your questions. Until then, I hope that others are able to
pick up the slack.

Hmm... now imagine if the top five question-answerers on this list are
all going through roughly the same thing....

I'm just asking everyone to remember to have respect for the volunteers
who answer your questions on this list. I appreciate them all.

JBR.

Lee Chalupa wrote:

> I take the time every day to read and think about the posts in this
> group in the hopes that I
> can learn and someday help others that have the same questions that I
> do. I feel part of the cost of
> membership of any group is to listen and participate even if it is to
> only read other people's questions and thoughts.
> If you don't feel like helping me, that is your decision and I respect
> that. What I would ask of you is to limit
> the frivolous chatter in this group that seems to fill my inbox
> including your pompous lectures that imply that you are
> some kind of royalty so that replies that have useful content can get
> their due attention.
>
> lee
>
>
>
> 12/27/01 12:54:47 PM, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...> wrote:
>
> >
> >
> >
> > You are not entitled to answers. No-one is entitled to answers. We do
> > not do your job for you. We help you, perhaps, out of the goodness of
> > our hearts, when we have time and when we know the answers. You may
> > perhaps allow for the possibility that we are on vacation and not
> > sitting by our internet connections, just waiting to answer every
> one of
> > your questions.
> >
> > You are forthwith ignored.
> >
> > Sorry for the tenor of the response, but I grow tired of people who
> > think they own my ass because I contribute to this list.
> >
> > JBR.
> >
> > lchalupa wrote:
> >
> > > Would someone please take a look at a posting from me on the JUNIT
> > > group a two days ago.
> > > It concerns how to test a method that uses jOptionPane. I got one
> > reply.
> > >
> > > In the meantime, what else got a response? Well, we seem to
> have time
> > > to respond to trivial subjects and partake
> > > in what is nothing short of mental masturbation and ignore
> substantive
> > > questions that require some effort.
> > > I think I have read about 30 messages about getters and setters that
> > > sounds more like a pissing contest. And then there is the chatter
> > > about one piece of spam. How many worthless messages did this
> "spam"
> > > generate? Boy we nailed that one didn't we?
> > >
> > > If you need someone to chat with, get a dog. I got one, he just
> > > doesn't know java/junit...yet.
> > >
> > > Sorry for the vent but I grow tired of groping in the dark.
> > >
> > > Thanks for your help.
> > >
> > > Lee Chalupa
> >
